alternative_parents.description: Cyclic organooxygen compounds containing the structure RC(=N)N where the central carbon atom and one of the linked nitrogen atoms are part of the same ring( R here is an organyl group). They can also be viewed as analogs of lactams where the oxygen atom is replaced by a nitrogen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Imidolactams

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a pyrazoline ring, which is a five-member saturated aliphatic ring with two nitrogen atoms (at positions 1 and 2) and three carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Pyrazolines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing an aromatic ring where a carbon atom is linked to an hetero atom.
alternative_parents.name: Heteroaromatic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a furan ring, which is a five-member aromatic ring with one oxygen atom, four carbon atoms.
alternative_parents.name: Furans

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of diazene(diimide), HN=NH, wherein both hydrogens are substituted by hydrocarbyl groups, e.g. PhN=NPh azobenzene or diphenyldiazene.
alternative_parents.name: Azo compounds

alternative_parents.description: Vinyl halides in which a chlorine atom is bonded to an sp2-hybridised carbon atom.
alternative_parents.name: Vinyl chlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure  X#N+-Z- <-> X-=N+=Z <-> X-=N-Z+ <-> X-N=Z (X = C or O, Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Propargyl-type 1,3-dipolar organic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one oxygen atom linked to a ring carbon.
alternative_parents.name: Oxacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic salt compounds containing a transition metal atom in its ionic form.
alternative_parents.name: Organic transition metal salts

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing metals and halogens. Some are ionic while others are covalently bonded.
alternative_parents.name: Organic metal halides

alternative_parents.description: Compounds derived from an alkene by replacing a hydrogen atom with a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Chloroalkenes

alternative_parents.description: 1,3-dipolar compounds with the general structure X:-C=Z<-> X+=C-Z- (X = C or N; Z = C, N, or O).
alternative_parents.name: Carbene-type 1,3-dipolar compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing an heterocycle with at least one nitrogen atom and one carbon atom linked to each other.
alternative_parents.name: Azacyclic compounds

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of oxoacids RnE(=O)OH in which the hydroxy group is replaced by an amino group and the oxo group is replaced by =NR. Amidines include carboxamidines, sulfinamidines and phosphinamidines.
alternative_parents.name: Amidines

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a bond between carbon a pnictogen atom. Pnictogens are p-block element atoms that are in the group 15 of the periodic table.
alternative_parents.name: Organopnictogen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Organic compounds containing a bond between a carbon atom and an oxygen atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organooxygen compounds

alternative_parents.description: Compounds containing a chemical bond between a carbon atom and a chlorine atom.
alternative_parents.name: Organochlorides

alternative_parents.description: Organic neutral compounds having formal unit electrical charges of opposite sign.
alternative_parents.name: Organic zwitterions

alternative_parents.description: Derivatives of hydrocarbons obtained by substituting one or more carbon atoms by an heteroatom. They contain at least one carbon atom and heteroatom.
alternative_parents.name: Hydrocarbon derivatives

description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as benzenoids. These are aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.

direct_parent.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
direct_parent.name: Benzenoids

kingdom.description: Compounds that contain at least one carbon atom, excluding isocyanide/cyanide and their non-hydrocarbyl derivatives, thiophosgene, carbon diselenide, carbon monosulfide, carbon disulfide, carbon subsulfide, carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, Carbon suboxide, and dicarbon monoxide.
kingdom.name: Organic compounds

superclass.description: Aromatic compounds containing one or more benzene rings.
superclass.name: Benzenoids
